intro: Pedicularis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling those of orchids. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
